dir-glob

Convert directories to glob compatible strings

Install

$ npm install dir-glob

Usage

```js const dirGlob = require(‘dir-glob’);

dirGlob([‘index.js’, ‘test.js’, ‘fixtures’]).then(files => { console.log(files); //=> [‘index.js’, ‘test.js’, ‘fixtures/**’] });

dirGlob([‘lib/’, ‘fixtures’], { files: [‘test’, ‘unicorn’] extensions: [‘js’] }).then(files => { console.log(files); //=> [‘lib/’, ‘fixtures//test.js’, ‘fixtures//unicorn.js’] });

dirGlob([‘lib/*’, ‘fixtures’], { files: [‘test’, ‘unicorn’, ‘.jsx’], extensions: [‘js’, ‘png’] }).then(files => { console.log(files); //=> [‘lib/’, ‘fixtures//test.{js,png}’, ‘fixtures//unicorn.{js,png}’, ‘fixtures//*.jsx’] }); ```

API

dirGlob(input, [options])

Returns a Promise for an array of glob strings.

dirGlob.sync(input, [options])

Returns an array of glob strings.

input

Type: Array string

A string or an Array of paths.

options

extensions

Type: Array

Append extensions to the end of your globs.

files

Type: Array

Only glob for certain files.
